channel.title: Security on My External Brain
channel.description: Recent content in Security on My External Brain

item.title: HTTPS
item.description: This article is mostly my summary of the Wikipedia page on HTTPS1 and TLS2. HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, however I was interested in how the security of HTTPS is made up. HTTS is also named HTTP over TLS (previously HTTP over SSL). Here TLS is providing the layer of security that is supposed to protect our privacy and the integrity of the data we load and send.
